did.unittitle: Union League of Philadelphia Board of Directors records

bioghist.p: The Union League of Philadelphia was founded in 1862 as a patriotic society to support the policies of President Abraham Lincoln. It evolved to its current identity as a non-sectarian and non-partisan private club.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records from the Board of Directors of the Union League, including minutes of board meetings; general board files, which often contain records of the work of committees; special and general meetings; annual reports; election of officers; amendments to by-laws; and president's files. The record group has been arranged into seven series: Minutebooks and Minutes; General Files; Amendments to Bylaws; Election of Officers; General Meeting Minutes; Annual Reports; and Presidents' Files. President's files include incoming and some outgoing correspondence, scrapbooks, photographs, clippings, and reports.
